sentences.sContent: Five thousand employees came out on strike in protest at the poor working conditions.
sentences.sCn: 五千名雇员公开罢工，抗议恶劣的工作条件。

sentences.sContent: Thousands of people blocked the street, protesting against the new legislation.
sentences.sCn: 成千上万的人堵住了街道，抗议新法规。

sentences.sContent: ...who protest that government regulation would be yet another instance of interference in our lives...

phrases.pCn: 心甘情愿地；不反对地；[经]在“不保留异议”的情况下

remMethod.val: pro(很多) ＋ test(测验) → 考试太多， 遭到学生反对、 抗议 → 抗议， 反对

words.tran: 抗议者；反对者；持异议者

trans.tranOther: something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products
to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
